intro: Erigeron grayi, commonly known as Gray's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance.
